intro: Achillea aucheri, commonly known as the Armenian yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pale yellow to white composite flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
